intro: Rutidea tarennoides, commonly known as the Madagascar crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Rutidea tarennoides is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
